intro: Micromeria teneriffae f. subramosa, commonly known as the Canary Island micromeria, is a rare and endemic plant species native to Tenerife. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, adapting to the harsh environmental conditions of the Canary Islands. Its subspecies, subramosa, is distinguished by its more branched growth habit compared to the typical form. This plant plays a significant role in the local ecosystem and is of interest to botanists studying Mediterranean flora.
